common_issues.title: Pieces OS Bugs and Unexpected Behaviors
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS, including persistent selection mode, high RAM/CPU usage, and auto-generated context resetting to medium.  The selection bug involves unintended selection behavior, possibly related to shift/mouse click lock. High resource usage may be linked to internet connectivity.  The context setting issue involves the saved material enrichment option reverting to medium. Workarounds include restarting the application and manually adjusting settings.

related_issues.title: it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
related_issues.text:
it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.3.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not sure how to make it happen but its **extremely** annoying, it seems like it thinks I'm holding "shift" or "mouse 1", i use the arrow keys a lot but when this bug is active it selects instead of moving, when i try to click when its active it also selects, i cant ctrl + v when its active :(

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
related_issues.text:
Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Platform MacOS Version 15.5 (Build 24F74)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello!

This is an issue that I've seen happen in all of the builds since I've started using pieces. When changing the Auto-Generated Context (Saved Material Enrichment) option in Machine Learning from the menu, in my case I want it to be "High", but every time I change it, when I check the next day or any time later, or every time the app or os updates, the option selected goes back to "Medium". So I don't actually even know if it ever used "High", because it always returns the option to "Medium".
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Errors and Performance Degradation
common_issues.description: Users report issues with PiecesOS, including high RAM/CPU usage, LTM query failures after prolonged use, and "Workstream Summary" generation errors.  A common error message points to a missing Publisher Model in Google Vertex AI.  Short-term solutions include restarting PiecesOS.  Clearing LTM data via the UI is reportedly ineffective. Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and implement a permanent fix.

related_issues.title: LTM gets gunged up over time
related_issues.text:
LTM gets gunged up over time
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: PiecesOS macOS App Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing performance issues with the Pieces macOS app, including slow LTM queries, failure to clear LTM data, and auto-generated context settings reverting to default.  Additionally, high RAM and CPU usage have been reported. Restarting the app or clearing Pieces data may temporarily resolve some issues. Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and implement a permanent fix.

related_issues.title: LTM gets gunged up over time
related_issues.text:
LTM gets gunged up over time
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and extensions compatibility issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing compatibility issues between Pieces OS extensions (Raycast) and the Pieces desktop application.  Issues include Raycast extension incompatibility with newer Raycast versions and auto-generated context settings reverting to default.  Additionally, some users report failures generating workstream summaries.  Check for updates to both Pieces and related extensions. Ensure Pieces settings are saving correctly.  If issues persist, contact Pieces support with detailed logs and reproduction steps.

related_issues.title: Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast
related_issues.text:
Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast


### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Raycast Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

As mentioned on Discord, it appears that the Raycast needs to be updated to be compatible with (at least) the current version of Raycast 1.100.3. Trying to use any of the extension's functions triggers an error saying:

> Your Pieces Raycast Extension needs to be updated,...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/506778e6-5b13-4811-a21c-82c42384cb41)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate and address the "Publisher Model not found" error impacting Workstream Summary generation and other features.
Prioritize resolving the persistent selection mode bug in Pieces OS, as it significantly impacts usability.
Investigate and fix the high RAM/CPU usage issue affecting both Windows and macOS users.
Address the LTM query failures and data clearing issues on macOS.
Ensure the auto-generated context settings are saving correctly across different platforms and after application restarts.
Update the Raycast extension for compatibility with the latest Raycast versions.
